comments.body: Absolutely yes! I often use my off hand for eating and placing blocks, and it is really helpful on Java, but when I play it on Bedrock, it really restricts my actions! I hope they add this!
I HAVE WANTED THIS IN THE GAME EVER SINCE I GOT THE GAME
How has this not happened! If I can hold a shield it can’t be that much more code to hold a torch!
Yes! At least give bedrock torches, tools, firework use with Elytra, and food. Even better if they can add blocks because being able to hold two types of blocks would be sooo useful for building.
If an item is enchanted with mending, holding it in your off-hand while fishing is the best way to repair it in Java Edition. Items are painful to repair in Bedrock without it.

I immediately think: Yes! amazing idea, but how would that effect controller players? how does that work for the people who play on controller? because an easy right click on the mouse to use something on your offhand would be odd. like assume something thats in your offhand. like food. and your holding a hoe, trying to hoe the land. what would it prefer? or is it like that on java too?? or would the offhand not affect controller players? 

 

i think Mojang hasnt put it in because implementing it onto controller would be hard.
In Java it's pretty much just holding the item at waist level and a bunch of particles fly everywhere
On bedrock when you toss an item out of your inventory it gives a little tossing animation, It's the subtle things that make the game so much better and more immersive
In the Bedrock version I noticed that when other players are playing they don’t have the good looks that the Java version of the game has when doing so.
i hear there's a mod that does this, but also allows you to see a map that someone else is holding, too.
1. 1000coins
true
This is a Parity that will come in the future but at the moment it is hard to implement because of the lack of controls on mobile and the lack of buttons on Controllers.
I hope this how it work:if we want to use offhand item we crouch just like if want to use shield
Agreed
Thank you this will hopefully get noticed by mojang and will help with bedrock so much such as we will be able to repair silk touch items like pickaxes so much easier

I

want

this

so

bad
This is truly what we need. I would just look SO awesome holding both a lantern & a sword in my Bedrock world!

Technically, you can use the shield in Bedrock if you crouch, but I agree. Having that kind of button in Bedrock would be a game changer. And the View button on an Xbox controller can be mapped to any function, so why not use that button?

It would be nice to have Java's offhand in Bedrock and Legacy. For example, in the Battle Mini-Game, you could block an attack with a shield, or place TNT down. I understand why it's not on Bedrock (prob cause of controller support) but you could have it to where you could switch between placing blocks and using your offhand for certain things, like what the Registered User said about activating the shields by pressing View (Xbox), - (Switch), or the touchpad (PS). Think about this for a couple days, Lady Agnes.
In addition to this, they should add an input for the offhand. One example would be to use the left d-pad to switch an item from your mainhand to your offhand.
Please add this feature in bedrock edition

This is a great suggestion, Hardcore mode is great because it adds more weight to your worlds when they could be deleted. As it stands, I have a hard time enjoying the game when losing has minor consequence.
Greater players need greater challenges

I 100% agree, hardcore on bedrock can up the challenge! And Bedrock content creators find it hard to make timelapses as far as I'm aware.  As of right now the only way to get hardcore/spectator mode is add-ons, but then you lose the iconic fealing not to metion losing achivements.
I agree but java was the original version so it should get more love but still I agree. Oh and giants and illusionears
SlyDecidueye I agree with the last bit
To było by miłe gdyby Mojang mógł to dodać popieram ten pomysł.

As a programmer myself, you have no idea how long it takes to code. That said, Spectator mode is a gaping hole when developing content for the minecraft bedrock marketplace. Its a tool that is woefully missing.
I meant hardcore mode (I am about to edit that, thank you for picking up on my mistake)

Make Spectator mode where the administrator of a particular game can put a person in spectator mode if they want to film timelapses of a main character. I want this because I want to use my second account as a way to do just that. (It's not called CoytCamera for no reason after all.)
it will be great having hardcore in minecraft bedrock edition so i will not use hardcore mods
Bedrock need spectator mode because it is hard to explore the caves and cliffs update
Good idea
You have my vote because Spectator mode is an ABSOLUTE MUST, but hardcore may cause problems, as there are many bugs in bedrock that may cause the unfair end of a hardcore world.
Apparently Hardcore in Bedrock is coming this spring. There will also be Realms Hardcore on Both Java and Bedrock.
Give it to bedrock or take it away from java
Yes this could be done if mojang adjust the height build limit in nether dimension. I personally would love this alteration

Even Console Edition (which is sadly discontinued but shouldn’t be discontinued) has this features although it was broken over updates. Being on the nether roof is a nightmare on Console Edition now, since you cannot break blocks on top of it, it is full of barriers and ender pearls do not teleport you on top of it. It used to work fine on Console Edition but sadly it was made to be a nightmare.
I want this to be added because I play bedrock and I'm wanting to build a base above the nether
Mojang probably won't because it's a bug, however, you should be able to just in case if you accidentally get stuck up there and you can't build a portal to leave

I disagree with the notion that; because accessing the roof is a bug it shouldn't be acknowledged on Bedrock. As of late they're taking many strides with game parity and this is one of those key game differences that really needs to be adressed. So much video content has been made by some of the biggest Minecraft YT creators constructing what are yes unique but also very Late-Game builds on the roof. Bedrock players hould be able to take full advantage of this, or java should lose build access. This will be the biggest parity change they'll have to face imo, other then the "Enchantment Table" vs "Enchanting Table" situation...
And it also wouldn't feel right to take it away from Java players, so this should be added to Bedrock. It feels more like a feature than something unintended at this point.
This could also make it easier to leave the Beta if implemented correctly.

I think this is quite complicated to implement because of the console editions etc. Java has a version.jar for every version you play but Bedrock just has one executable which is the game. If you would implement such a version changer you would either have to make the version executables downloadable or you needed to stuff every version that ever existed into the executable which would make it unbelievably big
Please servers no error
they could make it to if you want to play an older version you could just download it whilst deleting the current one. only the version no world data deleted just the version

It's not that difficult after all...

  1. You download the Minecraft launcher from Play and App Store
  2. From the launcher, you download game files using Mojang servers, not from Google and Apple servers allowing you to pick version including betas and snapshots

Cmon Mojang you can do it!!

Perhaps this would work like it does in console edition (sorta).

In the main menu, theres the button to go back to "old minecraft". If we added this for other parts of the bedrock platform, it could work similar, only with an older version of that platform's game. Only downside I see is that the file size change would probably be a lot larger between some versions such as the initial change from 1.17 to 1.18.

I do like the idea tho :D 
+1 from me
I do wish that this was a thing

A low traffic realms server I play with family on is constantly out of date, and thus my constantly up to date client refuses to connect to it. Currently the third party version switchers are broken for me as well.
You should edit this post so it also says to make the dolphins grace a status effect on bedrock, because it currently isn’t, and as a mini game maker, that could make for some fun games
plz make this a thing, doesn't seem hard
love that you included an experiment and included data as well, please mojang I would love to see this parity fix.
A problem with fireworks in general; in Bedrock, they don’t harm anything and are merely for visuals.
ZillionBeret512 Thay actually do do damage!
i agree, it just fustrating to see them firework rocket to phase through mobs instead of exploding
Yes! though then you wouldnt be able to shoot them on the ground and create timed explosions

. C'mon friends. I've been playing this for 10 freakin years, bought and paid for this game on 3 seperate platforms. I LOVE this game. But us Bedrock players seem to be second class step-children. While I don't expect everything to be exactly like Java, this is a HUGE disparity, and frankly heartbreaking. Please fix this. Pretty please with gunpowder on top?
This is a great feature. Damn I really want to see this on Bedrock, fireworks for ammunition is the best.
The max damage a crossbow can outpost is 29 hearts, but since fireworks don’t explode on impact they’re wildly inaccurate
@WizardlyAttic76 can you please change the title of the post so we can catch more bedrock eyes. Cause I don't think alot of bedrockers don't know that this is in java

This should be a priority in my opinion. This isn't one of those minor issues with parity. This is effecting an otherwise powerful weapon in combat. I use fireworks for crossbows all the time in java. In bedrock it's completely useless.
Can confirm, without this parity feature crossbows are only good as terrible non-stacking fuel on Bedrock :(

A simple solution would just be giving fireworks a hitbox when it touches other entities or blocks and have a function where it detonates once touching either things, its very simple to implement in a behavior pack but is a little upsetting that its not in the base game. Having a feature as miniscule as fireworks being shot from a firework been dumbed down from a fun way of using a crossbow (which is a weapon) to now being purely visual. Which it just being visual is completely useless since dispensers can shoot fireworks faster and with less cost. The crossbow was my absolute favorite feature in 1.14 and seeing it as it is now In Bedrock compared to it's functionality and versatility in Java is downright upsetting and I think was just result of laziness from the developers. Although parity of crossbows from java to bedrock would be a dream come true, its unfortunately too far fetched to ever happen.
I agree, firework crossbows are important weapons to have, but they don't work in Bedrock as rockets don't explode on impact! Please fix this ASAP.
I hope Mojang will see it!

This must be changed as soon as possible. It is pretty much a design-mechanic problem. I mean, why bothering giving the player the option to use fireworks when they will simply do nothing? Also, trying to  aim the fireworks on Bedrock is so difficult, different from Java.

Things to get solved:

  • Fireworks dealing damage as in Java
  • Fireworks exploding on contact (blocks and entities)
  • Fireworks from Crossbows improved AIM.
  • Fireworks from Crossbows improved behaviour.
Talbes lo agragen en lecho rocoso en la combat unptade 👌
Talbes lo agragen en berdrock en la combat unptade 👌
I have been wanting this for a while
Is a bad idea, for Mobile players that gonna be unfair

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360077488172/comments/4417072259981

No, I don't think this is unfair at all... This would just balance the combat. And it's always worse or in other words "unfair" to be on mobile, no matter what combat system we use
Getting this parity would be great for bedrock users who dont have a PC
We need this I’d love it so fed up of the old combat it’s nit engaging whatsoever and makes me feel like being in the bedrock pvp community is useless

It would be really nice to have the same type of combat from Java in Bedrock. however, one must also consider How it will adapt to the Mobile versions of Bedrock. it would be more complicated for these users, since for some low resource devices it will be more difficult to fight Mobs and animals with the lake and also the type of performance of these. It would help parity between Java and Bedrock, but it also has Disadvantages.
Estaría está bien que tengan el mismo sistema de combate ya que en móvil pegarle a cada mob es un poco complicado en cambio el combate de java pegariamos q varios mob a la vez

If people complain about lag (like most people usually do whenever somebody requests bedrock features or new additions like this for Java), Mojang can simply have snowy particles appear on the textures. They already have a similar system in place for transitioning the color of the leaves and grass for different adjacent biomes!
Good feature! Also supporting blocks in snow shouldn’t destroy the snow layer like grass. Also the snow layers should stack up when it snows like bedrock edition.
This is a very good feature, but not everyone may like it, so it should be a graphics option with the ability to disable in the graphics menu.
The snowy leaves effect should apply to azalea and cherry leaves.
This is a great idea
Maybe even after they play they slow down a bit and green particles show up. Great idea!
Even with a locater map I keep getting confused on the way back to my base

This feature will be very useful for making colored team bases being able to place banner icons on locator maps as Java Edition does with their maps. This feature is really great for listing color locations for SMP & Faction Servers playing vanilla settings on Bedrock Edition. Add the banner icons to Bedrock Edition maps.
I would like to see this as well,  I suggest that you take a copper ingot and a coloured glass block to make 4 coloured pins that are then used to mark a map location.

YES! I need banners working on bedrock. I'm currently using a one stack tall tower of dirt with a flower and torches on top to attempt to mark places of interest. Does not work for showing up on a map but you can see it if you get close enough.
I would love the banners to work like they do in Java.  I want to be able to name and colour the banner on various locations on my maps.  This is something I would use all of the time.
I would love this as I keep losing track of where I am when I play the game. My sense of direction is horrible
This feature would be an amazing add the game is adventure I would love to do that without loosing great places I’ve been to by marking them!
We need this so badly!
They should also add nbt tags
i think we should have this because i have wanted this for a couple months.
They should also make a way to get custom heads like a mini burger in survival without disabling achievements
They should let us kill ours self to get the head

That would be very creative. I'd like to see this added. The only question is how would it be added in creative? Through command? And in survival would you have to kill the other player in a certain way that you would get their head?

I’d really like that! I watched the hermitCraft server and I love custom player heads!!! We could make hat, skarf, glass, and more!! The way we should get them, they could add an item that each player shal get at the start of the world and then we could craft them!
It would be great if they added this because  I’ve been wanting this since forever and it would really add some life into our builds, I think you should get them through like a command block or /give
your wish will be granted, but only for the heads of Java players.
In java custom heads I vote for custom head for bedrock and pocket edition please vote
If Java has custom heads, Bedrock should too
They also need to add uncensored chat to Bedrock.
What I like about the Bedrock chat is that it has a freakin' scrollbar!
They should at least make this togglable for Windows 10 and the Console versions.
I'd absolutely love to see this come to the Windows 10 edition. It's such as waste of space. Keeping the scrollbar would be nice, though.

There is no reason for chat to fill the whole screen all the time, even in touch UI. How about a simple Java-like UI as the default and an optional full screen UI as a toggle with more history, buttons etc.

I think it should be added, but it probably wouldn't work for other devices that aren't computers. So, I think that the current bedrock one should be modified to not be fullscreen, while also supporting other devices. (Also, the chat is at the top because it would be covered up by the buttons on mobile.
While I see where you are going with this, I disagree. The developers of Bedrock like to try and release an update every month. The numbers don’t really matter, so I don’t see why it needs to change.

I think *major* versions should be consistent, perhaps with a "j" or a "b" tag on the end, such as "1.15j" vs "1.15b". Major updates (The World of Color, Villagers & Pillagers) and so on would be the same major version number. Of *COURSE* minor version numbers would be "untethered/ unrelated".

"I'm playing Minecraft 1.12!" Uhm… which version? "1.12, you know..." Ahem... What *PLATFORM*? "Oh! Java. Who plays Bedrock?" And there you go. *I* play both Bedrock and Java, but it breaks my brain hearing about "Minecraft 1.12" because I'm not clear on WHICH PLATFORM are we talking about, since "Minecraft" to many in the community refers exclusively and ONLY "Minecraft Java Edition."

And while we are on the topic, dear Notch PLEASE do not have EITHER platform do a major release... UNTIL IT IS READY FOR RELEASE. 1.14.0 was "not ready for release." That is pretty clear and obvious to many of the Minecraft Java Edition players. Demanding 1.14 to release when Bedrock was ready was a huge mistake that is a great disservice to Realm players, who can not choose what version, to Modders and Server ops, with an audience demanding a release that wasn't fit to release, to new players picking up Minecraft for the first time only to be stunned and amazed at how shoddy 1.14.0 was. DO NOT release before it's ready. I'm begging you. Just... don't. But otherwise, having the same "updates" in the same rough time-frame is cool.
Microsoft bought Minecraft Xbox is Microsoft Xbox should get first dibs
376634431651, I think they can use small update numbers (like 1.14.30) for their monthly parity/fix updates, but still keep the "main" feature update numbers (like 1.15) on par with Java.
We need this, that way, no one on bedrock has to use Minecraft Beta to get updates at the same time. Upvoted.
It’s all in line now for example the Nether Update is now 1.16 for both versions

Upvoted yes true so with the betas like right nows 1.17 betas and snapshots they gave java about half the update the cave part we wanted and they gave us bedrock just goats and snow why does java have more features mojang/microsoft fix this
Umm it's now 1.16 why is this there but if it was the same update right now I would agree

Probably not going to happen since Microsoft bought Minecraft and wants Bedrock to be the (Real) Minecraft but as a Bedrock and Java player can't agree more that I would like to have synchronized updates.
You know how you can place a slab on a 2 by 2 whole and crouch and walk through in Java you should add that and crawling in bedrock it would make it easier to go through the new 1 by your me caves
Make Java and bedrock more the same game than different games
At this point major versions are synchronized, and minor versions might start heading that way too.

I don't love the idea of making cauldrons immovable - seems like it'd break a lot of redstone contraptions, even if composters are a viable replacement in most cases - but adding the bedrock functionality to them would definitely be great!

Potion in cauldron
Color water in cauldron
Lava in cauldron

Lava in cauldron is already available in Java so please dear Mojang we need all three functionality of the cauldrons in Java too. Storing potions in which you can make tipped arrows also color normal water with dyes to dye leather armor! (Also hope the crafting recipe will be removed so that you can need to use the cauldron)
I like this idea a lot, and for whatever reason, Bedrock can have entities spawn with different size tags, which is a feature java really needs. (Baby squids, Dolphins, etc, etc)
I agree with the idea that fish need different sizes. There can be small, or even long fish. You know what I’m talking about? Different flavors of fish is what Java needs. Voted for the post.
I agreed. It would be even more fun if the Java Edition salmon also had the concept of size.
More live in ocean.
I'd be down for more sizes with the animals. Also I can't stand toycat going on about his precious salmon.
B I G  S A L M O N

Yes, Java players need to know what it feels like to see a big salmon swimming in their pond. I will be boycotting Java edition until this feature is added. Bedrock's salmon are one of the true joys in life, and Java players deserve that same luxury.
There should also be Cod Sizes.
No Big Salmon Should Stay Bedrock Exclusive! You Can Port Small Salmon To Java But Not Out Beautiful Big Dude!!!
394246715232 27 this idea is what i always wanted
This is a duplicate post
this would be very useful for mining
Yes please
Knockback improvement! Nice.
This has been added to the 1.16 beta and hopefully the release.
Ok
Jsjsn
So glad someone else think Java and bedrock should be similar.
I want a achievement
Can you make the achievements in beta shown on screen like in Java and Bedrock plsss thanks
Ihh
Ta
Pls make it happen
Its well be awesome so i voted you

In Java you get advancements every time you start a world, whereas in Bedrock once you have got that advancement you cannot get it again, regardless of whether it is in the same world or not. I think it should be more like Java in that there is a designated screen for it and you can get them multiple times. Also, you can get advancements with cheats on, but in Bedrock you can't. This is important for mobile players because I have to turn off mob greifing when I fight the wither, as it causes too much lag, and this means that I can't get cheats.
Like Bring the Achievement System to Bedrock!
We need this
Yes! This would give you something to actually do with all that wool filling your chests!!!
We need this
we all need this
This would make wool useful.
Or you could just sell the wool to the shepherds.

In Java Edition, wool, carpets, and string can already be used as furnace fuel

Since all of these items are made from flammable materials (like wool or wood), it makes sense for them to work as fuel. Players often end up with extra string,  or too many carpets, and being able to smelt them instead of tossing them would be a nice quality-of-life improvement.

Suggestions:


Add fuel functionality for wool, string, and carpets in Bedrock to match Java Edition.

Make the burn times balanced (short, like sticks or wooden tools) so it's useful but not overpowered.

This would make crafting and storage more efficient and give these items a bit more purpose once they’re no longer needed.

They should also add the multiple recipes as in Java, for example, if you want to make an acacia wood fence but you have several types of wood in your inventory, it would only let you make the oak wood one, not the others
this is unrelated but oreui ui screens look very unfaithful to minecraft i hope they don't replace the current ui.

I think this feature makes sense for new players that get shown what they can craft with the new material that they found, or when finding an item learning how to be able to craft it as well. It doesn’t make sense for a person that knows the crafting recipes to have to unlock them all again. So the unlocking recipes should be relative to the account and not to each world, similar to how the achievements currently work on Bedrock. That way once a player has learned a recipe, they also have that recipe available in the other worlds, and that for someone who has played hundreds of Minecraft worlds, doesn’t have to search for materials just to see the recipe for something they’ve crafted before.
You should make the animation much longer because we don't have sometimes the time to see everything we unlocked. Also, make the notification sound to be the same as Java!
We need java achievement too, or even making the nowdays achievement looks more like java ones and put it in offline mode too
I think this is a great change but it'd be nice if it was toggable because the UI popping up mid game for collecting items can be annoying.

Well, it is a great advance and parity with minecraft java, but I would like that, as in minecraft java, when crafting something, such as different types of wood, these are shown multiple times as in java, I would also like something added since they are making these improvements add some progress and they appear in the same way as minecraft java I hope you take these ideas thanks 😁

This is great, but it should be togglable. As an experienced player, this doesn't feel worthwhile to me without Advancements like Java, but I agree that it's a necessity for new players. So I think there should be a way to disable it, but it's great that you're working on this.

Could you please add that crafting recipes can be disabled at will, namely notifications, they can just interfere with the game, let the players choose how they play, that is, Crafting recipes will be enabled by default, but it could be disabled for a comfortable game. And please return the old boat crafting with a shovel so that you can craft a boat with a shovel and without a shovel, it was just fun with a shovel. And please optimize the minecraft bedrock a little so that it doesn't lag so often, that's all I have, I hope my review will help you in the development of minecraft bedrock.

I agree with the person that said this is unnecessary for people that already know all the recipes. It can get annoying for every world to be getting constant pop ups. The recipes being shared across worlds would also fix a few other issues, since after playing with recipes for a while it became clear that this is aimed at newer players. I think quick crafting is one of the best features, but the recipe unlock system has requirements that interrupt it and the flow of gameplay. I have to actually touch water be able to quick craft a boat or just wait a few minutes to be able to quick craft a chest. I know I can just craft them manually but it is unnecessary and interrupts usual gameplay. Worst of all, unlocking a new recipe resets the crafting table setting, which means I have to press craftable, my preferred setting, every time after I unlock something new. This also happens every single time I load into a world. Making it so that recipes are shared across worlds would make this bug less painful to deal with, since I doubt it will be fixed soon if it wasn't caught and fixed during tests. A toggle for recipes could also work, since I would much rather not have recipe unlocks than have to deal with the crafting table setting reset bug every time I load into a world.
Make a recipe book a loot.

You should add the java edition knowledge book as well so if you want to you can use commands to get it to unlock all of the recipes. Or you could add a /recipe command which unlocks or relocks recipes for certain players.
This is one thing I thought it was gonna get added one day for bedrock but I never knew it was gonna come today in the latest beta/preview

I think the Recipe Unlocking idea is horrendous. There's no need and is a QoL feature if this was *not* added. I'm an avid Minecraft player and I forget what materials and what order some recipes need to go. I don't want to go all the way to the Wiki with my terrible WiFi to find out a Recipe which can take me 1 second in-game. It's a pointless "progression" that wants to be added due to Java parity, it would make sense for Java to copy Bedrock with its all-unlocked recipes style. I believe the original idea was taken from Legacy Edition where everything was unlocked, and boy, it was such a life-saver to quickly smash a few buttons then fight off a creeper mid-way through. I just wouldn't be able to do that on a new world. I mean, what does feature even add? Most players just ignore it when it appears on the top-right corner so it doesn't even serve purpose. I'd much rather for developers to focus on something else rather than this worthless parity.

While it's certainly an amazing feature to have in the bedrock edition, I feel like the UI might come and go a tad too fast. In my opinion, it would be beneficial to create a new UI for it as the new bedrock UI is slowly going to make this older "java" UI feel less fitting to the bedrock UI.
I don't like the popup sound and I don't like the fact that on bedrock the popup appears from top to bottom and on java from right to left.

There should be a recipe book/unlocking feature
For all utility blocks and often-used blocks such as:
1-Smoker
2-Blast furnace
3-Smithing table
4-Furnace
5-Stone Cutter
It's really good idea and she look exactly like java version.

I know some player will not love that idea, but it can be better with little changes, but it cool to feel like u playing java version , i appreciate that i can see the pop up, but it need few little changes like : reducing its size , make it to bee the exact same as java , and add varient of it like java, but it loved the idea , and it need to be disabled if some player doesn't need it
it should make the same sound as java because its too loud and interupting, also the pop up takes up too much space it should have a slider or just have it scale with the ui scale

I personally hate unlocking recipes on Java. I prefer the Bedrock interface, where you can see what you need to craft what you want, then get the materials to make it, not having to randomly find the item to see the recipe to an item you forgot how to craft.

Crafting recipes manually with a controller is painful. Can we just acknowledge that Java and Bedrock are different things targeting different system types (pc vs console)? I avoided the game for years due to the horrendous interface Java brought only to discover Bedrock 1.18 was enjoyable on a console. Now you are doing everything to bring over everything I dislike about the game and force on Bedrock.

Maybe Java would be better if it moved more towards Bedrock instead of the other way around. The majority of players exist on Bedrock, why must we bow down to tiny Salmon and horribly implemented combat systems?

I did not like this new feature, I already did not like it in java for 2 reasons and now in bedrock, so I hope they do not take the automatic crafts, but for those who want I would like this feature to be left as optional, please, Thanks!

I have been playing  Minecraft since early PE versions, so I know most of the recipes. I understend that there are a lot of new players for whom it may be useful but there are also some who will be annoyed by seen messenges about unloking recipe for crafting table over and over again in every single world. It will be so good if this feacher will be added as toggle in accessibility settings.

Make it so that this feature can be enabled or disabled in the world settings before (and after), and make it enabled by default. This feature is great for new players but most old players already know how crafting works and it would be annoying to unlock a recipe that we forgot (which means we would have to google the recipes), so let people who dislike it to have an option to disable it.

The animation is way too fast and when i switch to 10 seconds it is way too long, there should be an option to make it 5-6 seconds just like java edition also the images of the items you can make change way too fast and Text is way too long on some languages, also the pop-up it's way too big but i don't know if it is because am using an unsupported language, and also i think the pop-up comes from another side, i'd also like if the sound of unlocking a recipe was the same as java and if possible a light mode, if these problems were fixed i would give this feature a 10/10

Instead of the Xbox notification sound for recipe unlocking sound it should be sound that Java used when the recipe unlocked shows up it less annoying and sounds ten times better and it should also side in from right to left and back like in Java

After thorough testing, I feel that the sound may be a bit too distracting, especially in the early game where you unlock lots of recipes in a short amount of time. It shouldn't be something that demands as much attention as an achievement, so the sound used in Java Edition would be a better fit. Other than that, no complaints!
I want the UI and sound effects to be the same as the java version.

After reading people's comments on recipe unlocks, I am starting to feel like it is a flawed feature fundamentally. I still don't think the game teaching you about recipes is a bad thing but it does kind of suck to have recipe book-crafting functionality locked behind it.

I feel like instead what would be better is the game notifying you, for the first time only and depending on what the recipes currently unlock by, that there is a recipe in your recipe book that you might want to craft.

The recipe book functionality itself is unchanged and you can still go about playing the way you're used to. And if you get annoyed by the recipe suggestion toasts, then there can simply be an accessibility option to turn them off. Feel like this is the simplest solution.

Basically keeping the notifications (and making them optional), but not gating functionality behind them (but if you do want to, then there can be gamerules for that, such as the doLimitedCrafting gamerule on Java)

The main thing I really like about recipe unlocks is teaching players about new things they can craft once they get an appropriate item or are in an appropriate context. I do not really mind how it is currently implemented but I can understand why people are upset because it is basically taking away functionality from the recipe book until you unlock the recipes. Also, as the feature stands right now, it is not optional, which some players do want.
its cool but i think the noti sound should sound diffrent to like javas or somthing or remove the sound

I didn't like the new feature for 3 reasons:1: this feature is annoying for long-time professional players, this feature is more useful for new players because they don't know the recipes, but for older players in the game they already know all the recipes and not having access to the full recipes is something very annoying / 2:The recipes are zeroed when creating a new world, Bedrock's achievements are valid for all worlds and not just for each one, with the new feature always when creating a new world you will lose all the recipes and have to conquer them all again, and this irritates because it is something you already know,  so you shouldn't have to learn again,So the recipes should be valid for the whole game and not for each world individually/3:Notifications appearing all the time on the screen is terrible,always when unlocking a recipe appears the pop-up on the player's screen ends up being something too annoying,you are venturing into your world when out of nowhere you hear and see the pop-up appearing on the screen"as if it were an ADVERTISEMENT"is so unbearable that it would be very boring to play,as if it were no longer enough the achievements appearing in that large rectangle on top,it should be something smaller,less scandalous and more discreet audible warning,So less hassle.In conclusion:when creating a world have how to activate or not,and can change the option when editing a world already created if the player has already gotten angry and does not want more.

Great idea, it makes us look into the new recipe and see we are progressing in the game possibilities.

I want the integrated recipe unlock to be the same as the Java Edition recipe unlock sound.

I like it, I feel like the sound is a bit weird since it's the same for invites and download/import notifications. I think it needs to (no pun intended) sound a little bit simpler like a ding if that makes sense

The latest Bedrock Beta (1.20.10.21) introduces recipe unlocking as an experimental feature! This feature, previously exclusive to Java Edition, allows players to unlock crafting recipes simply by collecting related items, making it much easier to quickly build up your recipe repertoire!

As this is still in development and some of the unlocks have changed from what players may be familiar with in Java Edition, your feedback is important - does the unlocking criteria feel right, does it feel intuitive? Let us know what you think in the comments!

I think it would be great if the toast could slide in from the right to the left, just like in Java Edition.

Also, after a few recipe unlock toast, the default notification sound starts to get annoying. I believe using the Java swoosh sound as the default notification sound for recipe toasts would be a much better fit.
Will if you added this feature can you add advancements?

This is almost Perfect, I know that the Recipe Unlocking uses the same Tech as Toast Notification (Game Invite Popup/Addon Install Popup) that's why the Time for the Notification can be increased via the Toast Notification Slider in Accessibility Settings, that's also the Reason why Recipe Unlocking has same Sound as the Toast Notification sound (Xbox Notification Sound) and uses the same colour as Toast Notification which is black, which feels Faithful to Bedrock Edition and matches the Ore UI theme Perfectly and should be kept like that and maybe decorate it more by adding some borders to it, nothing needs to be changed except increase the Time of an item shown in the Recipe Unlocking Toast Notification because it quickly Swifts through all the Items unlocked even after Increasing the Time of Toast Notification and the sound, decrease the Volume of the Xbox Notification Sound not just in Recipe Unlocking but from Toast Notification in General like Xbox Game Invites and Addon Installing.
Foi um ótimo recurso,mas faltou as conquistas por que tem gente que não consegue criar uma conta

this would greatly improve this feature

I think an ideal solution is to add an option when creating the world called "unlocked recipes", this option would not prevent achievements.

New worlds would have that option disabled by default, and it will be up to each player to keep it enabled or disabled, depending on their preference.

This option could be turned on or off again after the world has been created.
This kinda feels like what Bedrock has been missing. Or at least part of it.
Also 5 seconds should be the default time for every pop-up sometimes i can't see the achievements i unlock because 3 seconds is not much time and 10 seconds is way too much same with recipe unlocking

I'm a little confused as to why this is a necessary addition to bedrock. We have the recipe book, I personally don't see how this is useful to even new players. I feel like it will add unnecessary pop-ups and data to worlds, especially thinking about small screens and lower storage devices.

If we are going to have something like this added why can't we have per world advancements added instead? Keep the achievement system as per user, but having java style advancements as well, with the advancement screen and everything, I think would be more beneficial and guide new players to actually shoot for the achievements. There aren't enough new players who are going to search online to see what kind of things need to be done to get all the achievements.

Can you make this an in-game option? For this, I don't want to see this pop up on every new game my nephews or nieces make daily; I would rather have all "Recipe unlocked," and if I want it on, then we can do that in game mode. I don't want to be spammed with a message telling me "Wood does this".

This feature is not needed. I do not understand the purpose of the feature or the intention of implementing it. I understand parity is a concern however most of the parity changes that are happening are not only on Bedrock but sometimes take features away from players that could have easily been added to Java. This feature specifically takes away the ease of access to all crafting recipes and adds an unneeded barrier in its place. If this feature does go through please allow for players to be able to toggle it on and off.

I think that the feature is nice but I would like it if there was a way to disable it because I personally like being able to see all the recipes from the start, so I can know what items/blocks I need to look out for without needing to search the recipes online.

I think it's very smart, and I'm glad it's being added!
Perhaps they should make it so if you have 1-3 items in one recipe (Depending on how important/complex it is) then you can see the item but not the recipe, or perhaps see the recipe and where the pieces you have go, but the rest of the pieces are covered by question marks?
This is just going to make it harder for new players to learn what's needed for recipes. The recipe book should honestly stay the way it is.

I really like this idea
It'll add more realism to the game
this would add a new way to advance in the game and would allow you to keep track of how far you've gotten just by looking at your recipes
this is a great feature for bedrock! I think that next up should be the java advancement system! i know you probably wont see this but still.

No! BOO!! You can't make me like this! NO!

Really like there's an option for it to be toggled on and off. Please make sure this is off by default in marketplace worlds submitted before this was a feature. It's very important that players are not bombarded with unnecessary information when they pick up a log or something if it is not relevant to the mini game, adventure or whatever game mode it is. When this was rolled out on Java it caused a lot of problems in the map making community and I'm hoping this is taken into consideration this time around and done the right way to support older content before this was a feature that could result in unintended behavior.

yes please!! ive been a java edition player for 10+ years and only recently got bedrock so i could play cross platform with friends on their realm. they have it set to hard and my portal spawned in a soul sand valley. before we got elytras it was brutal. the entire valley is on fire because i would shoot one ghast and 3 more would instantly spawn. i play on a computer so i can shoot them down easily but my friends play on console and couldnt even navigate the nether because the ghasts spawned faster than they could move the crosshair to shoot them. its ridiculous.

Yes. The Nether almost isn't even fun. Correction: Optifine smart leaves are actually not the same as Bedrock leaves. I assumed they were because I was testing individual leaves, and they looked similar. But when I used actual trees I realized that Optifine would make faces of leaves that were connected to other leaves transparent too, giving the tree a hollow look. In bedrock, if leaves are connected to other leaves from all directions they become a solid non-transparent block

JAVA

 

BEDROCK
